title: Jitish Kallat
summary: Jitish Kallat (born 1974) is a prominent Indian contemporary artist based in Mumbai. He earned his BFA in painting from Sir JJ School of Art in 1996, the same year he held his debut solo exhibition "PTO." Kallat's diverse practice encompasses painting, photography, collages, sculpture, installations, and multimedia works. His art frequently explores themes of self, time, death, life cycles, celestial references, familial ancestry, and the urban Indian landscape. Notably, he served as the Artistic Director for the 2014 Kochi-Muziris Biennale. Kallat is currently represented by several international and Indian galleries and is a trustee for the India Foundation for the Arts.

current_status: Jitish Kallat lives and works in Mumbai, India. He is actively represented by major art galleries including Nature Morte, Chemould Prescott Road, ARNDT, and Galerie Daniel Templon. He also serves on the Board of Trustees of the India Foundation for the Arts, continuing his multifaceted career as an artist and art figure.
